text: Daje wszystko co obiecuje :) Intensywny aromat wanilii, Bourbonu, piernika, gałki muszkatołowej, pumpernikla, cynamonu. W smaku przyjemnie kremowe, pełne, wanilia, cynamon, czekolada. Świetne!

Dark brown color. Sweet unbelievable refined, oak, vanilla, gingerbread, coconut, and fudge. Very lucious sweet mouth with tons of coconuts, oak, bourbon, gingerbread and dark amazing. The bourbon is so refined and well integrated. Love it.

Poured from bomber. Thanks to Maxbier for sharing. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Wonderful gingerbread flavor with sweet vanilla, chocolate, ginger, cinnamon and followed by a bourbon and oak flavor. Really fantastic!

On tap at Barrel & Bushel. Black with small light brown head. Aroma is light bourbon, medium body, medium carbonation, and thick small-bubble lacing. Taste is dark chocolate, ginger, some bourbon, fruity, and a little ash.

Aroma chocolate chip cookie in a bourbon barrel. Very unusual, very tasty. Like a fudge bake shop in a bourbon barrel house. Some cocoa bitter. Lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Spices, chocolate, coffee, cookies, sweet, full-bodied.

Poured from bottle 2016 release received in a reddit secret santa 2016 swap. Dark chocolate pour with a nice creamy tan head. Aromas of luscious vanilla caramel ginger molasses. Taste is sweet creamy wonderful mouth feel and follows flavor with the ABV well hidden. This is a nice treat and I will need to get more.

750ml bottle pours dark brown black with a finger of tan head. Nose and tast have lots of spice, of course, pretty good level of chocolately roast and cocoa to back up the spice. nice creamy mouthfeel, bits of vanilla, ginger, cinnamon. Dont really get much in the way of bourbon or oak barrel character from the beer other than perhaps a bit more nutty vanilla on the finish, not substantially different than regular GBS.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster showing thick translucent coffee rims with a pitch black center and a finger of latte colored foam. 

The nose shows a strong gingerbread forwardness upon a moderately intense bourbon background. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Gingerbread forward flavors with gingerbread spices of cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg with a caramel finish. Moderate ginger spiciness throughout the beer. Surprisingly little bourbon barrel influence.
very good stuff. chocolate and malty aroma, some ginger and other spices. i really liked this one. alcohol warming made this a good sipping brew

Hardywood continues to impress with barrel aging. This barrel aged version of Gingerbread Stout is complex, its spinning a lot of plates at once. But it doesnt drop a single one, and the show is glorious. This beer pours big and brown with average head. The aroma is just a series of clamoring nosegasms. Everything you might think could possibly be there is there in spades, with vanilla and ginger and spice and raisins all blending perfectly into that delicious stout malt base. The flavor manages to pack it all in there, keep the tones bright and distinct, and not lose a bit of it. This aint noise. This is music. At once there is a rush of bourbon barrel aging, cinnamon, candied fruit, candied nuts, and big, sweet malt. It never gets old. It never becomes cloying. Its crazy. I am so completely Hardywoods bitch right now, and if anyone gave me shit about it, Id point to beers like this. If I ever have another child, Im naming that kid Hardywood.
2015 Bomber. Pours black with thick brown head. Aroma is sweet gingerbread. Taste is sweet gingerbread with a bourbon spice finish. I dig it and like it bette than the regular gingerbread.

2105 bottle poured into a snifter..opaque with a medium tan head..wonderful aroma of gingerbread,spices,bourbon,coffee,chocolate..taste of cinnamon,
nutmeg,coffee,bourbon,chocolate..little thin..but tasty.
Bottle thanks to Bruce. Pours a black color with a solid tan head. Thinner than the apple brandy GBS. Cinnamon and gingerbread chocolate. Long toasty finish.
Bottle share @ DLD 2016. Pour is black with a small beige head. Flavor and aroma of bourbon, ginger snaps, brown sugar, molasses, and a touch of cinnamon.
Aromas of ginger, vanilla, caramel, zesty. Brown black with a fairly lasting beige head. A nice balance of sweet and dry, spicy, kind of tastes like Italian custard. Full bodied.

Bottle thanks to Cliff, this one ive wanted to try, the bourbon really mutes a lot of the adjuncts. I dont like adjuncts in a beer, and I dont know why I get upset when I dont taste them. It must me that it takes me back to college in my dogfish head days when all these crazy claims on beer and its just bitter and sweet. I never tasted the adjuncts and it annoyed me. Well this is the same, the base is your average stout, and the bourbon influence is light.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 Spice/Herb/Vegetable #50. From notes. EBF 2016. Pours dark brown with a dark beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate and ginger snap. Flavor is dark chocolate, molases, gingerbread cookie. Mild bourbon and oak in the finish.
Sample at EBF 2016 Bourbon vanilla and oak behind some brown sugary maltiness with plenty of ginger to back it up. Almost too much ginger for my tastes, but I quite enjoyed this beer.

July 18, 2015. Bottle, 2013 vintage at Quebec tasting, thanks for sharing!  Dark brown, almost black with a small tan head. Aroma is bourbon, gingerbread cake with toffee, vanilla,ginger, cinnamon and very light roast. Taste is sweet and spicy, soft bitter. Finish is malty with sweet toffee, vanilla, bourbon, hints of dark berries, spicy ginger and cinnamon notes with a light roasted bitterness. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Better than the regular which was a bit thinner and with less well integrated flavors.
Shared bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of ginger, bourbon, and chocolate. Taste is ginger, chocolate, bourbon, roasted malt, vanilla, and some oak. Excellent.

Draft Extreme Beer Fest 2016. Pitch black color, Thin tan head. Aroma is very light ginger bread with bourbon and chocolate notes. 
Flavor chewy molasses, dark chocolate nuances, honey with a mild gingersnap cookie. The Bourbon is lasting and does wonders bring all the flavors together. Nice full, thick mouthfeel. I dont even taste the alcohol. Very well constructed and I cant believe how great this is! I would seek out a bottle.
Yes. Fantastic. Big Graham cracker scent and taste. Cinnamon, sugars and the bourbon barrel brings in some extra booze for a soothing bite. Nice dark coloring and palate is thick. Tap

25.4 oz bottle, my 100th rated Spice/Herb/Vegetable! Dark brown with a creamy beige head. Nose is bourbon, ginger, coffee and caramel with hints of black cherry. Coating medium to full body with a tang finishing sticky with soft carb. Taste is bourbon, candied ginger, vanilla and coconut milk. A bit burnt on the backside with residual spice. Im not sure the bourbon is the best compliment for the ginger but still tasty.
Bottle from Craigs, dregs run tasting. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of ginger, chocolate, faint oak. Taste is vanilla, dark caramel, light spice on the finish. Thinner than the original.

(Bottle) Dark brown body, small tan head. Sugar, chocolate, molasses-gingerbread, vanilla, and bourbon aroma. Medium body, sticky mouthfeel. Flavor of vanilla, molasses, light bourbon, hint of ginger. Very sweet.
Bottle round Daves. Pours pretty dark. Not so obvious barrel aged aroma. Bready biscuity dark slight rum truffle aromas. Spice character. Oak. Pretty good.
Bottle at craigs. Pours black, nose is ginger, vanilla, chocolate, cake, taste is similar, sweet, oak, bitter.

Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma of gingerbread, spices, chocolate, oak. Taste is rich, lots of coconut, gingerbread and chocolate, the flavours work so well together. Medium body with a clean finish.
Pours opaque black with no head. Aroma is ginger, vanilla, oak and leather. Taste is heavy gingerbread, cinnamon, vanilla, oak, leather, cocoa bitter slight roast.

Bottle at home... Dark black.. Thick tan head... Soft sweet chocolate roast... Big ginger spice.. Big coconut nose... Dark chocolate roast.. Big malts.. Big coconut.. Rich roast... Big malts.. Rich chocolate

750ml->snifter. Tried next to regular GBS. Deep brown with small tan head. Vanilla, chocolate, oak, ginger and mild holiday spice, mild bourbon, The barrel aging has subdued the ginger and holiday spice character, which is a good thing for me. Nice, tasty.

Tap. Jet black, thin light tan head. Gingerbread is clear in the aroma, with vanilla, toast, fig, and dark chocolate in the aroma. Last year when I had this, I thought it was touch sweeter, so pleasantly surprised this sampling. Bourbon is there but not overpowering, touch savory wood and spice, vanilla, and bready dark chocolate cake. Medium viscous body.

Aroma: cinnamon, vanilla, bourbon, ginger, caramel, coconut
Appearance: black with a brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

Draft at Mekong. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Solid bourbon notes on the nose along with the ginger. I think the barrel aging muted the big ginger and chocolate notes on the tongue though it's still tasty. Finished clean. Hides it's booze well. It's solid but I prefer the standard version. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells delicious, like a gingerbread man. Taste is pretty much all chocolate malt and gingerbread cookie. Medium body, medium carbonation, mild foam, and very slight alcohol heat.

bottle shared at our big bottle share tasting. poured darker black colour with a tanned head on top. aroma is bursting with spices, herbal ginger, nutmeg, roasted malts, vanilla, cinnamon, cloves, cant detect any bourbon in there because its overpowered by all the spices. not my cup of tea

2014 bottle. Black with brown foam. Aroma certainly as advertised. Gingerbread spices and vanilla. Bourbon notes backing it up. Light fruits at the edges. Taste starts with sweet cocoa, bourbon and spice notes then kick in. Drying, woody finish. Taste is a bit harsher than aroma but still nice. An impressive creation.

Had a vertical of 2013-2015. 2014 was drinking the best. 2013 was a bit past its prime and really didnt get as much Ginger bread. I recommend sitting on this beer for year. So my rating is for the 2014

750ml bottle thanks to rich. Pours out a dark brown topped with a tan head. Nose is holy cinnamon gingerbread sweetness chocolate marshmallow roast malts. Taste is more of the cinnamon gingerbread roast malts plenty sweetness and some barrel notes.

How: Bottle (750 ml) at tasting. From Frank, thanks!

>>> A good barrel-aged spicy stout that, despite not being easy drinking even for the style, is rather cohesive and well "balanced". 

+  Spices, bourbon, caramel, and vanilla share the spotlight in a rather cohesive way 
+  The barrel treatment is well executed and not overwhelming 
−  Despite being rather well balanced, a flavor profile like this one make the beer cloying quickly 
−  Although its deeper and more complex than the regular version, it still only have an average body for the style
○  Much better than the non barrel-aged version, which was really thin

Flavors:  Ginger, bourbon, roasted malts, cinnamon, vanilla, caramel

Bottle 750ml.
Pours dark brown with low-medium beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of spices, alcohol. Taste is of spices, alcohol. Palate: Medium body. Light-medium carbonation. Overall: Quite good. Way better than regular version.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2015 Pours a dark brown with a small beige head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of gingerbread and ginger. Taste is of ginger, moderately sweet, slightly fruity and end on gentle bourbon flavors. Body is medium-full and carbonation moderate. Pretty good.

pours unclear dark brown with a small creamy beige cap, good retention and lacing. spicy roasted ginger, lactose, bourbon, offensive cinnamon, chocolate, burnt caraeml , miscellaneous spices. light carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet and very spicy finish. o-k.

Bottle. Dark brown almost black pour with thin off white head. Aroma is spicy, malty, light vegetal notes, roasty malt, nice vanilla. Taste is spicy, tons of gingerbread, bourbon, vanilla. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation. Nice.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong spice, bourbon, wood, cinnamon. Thick mouth, rich malt, nutmeg, bourbon, vanilla, spice finish, really enjoyed this one.
Bomber shared by Armin...thanks! Dark brown pour. Aroma is gingerbread and spices. Taste follows with nice finish. Not a favorite style yet but Id like to try more, this one was good.

Bottle shared by Armin, thanks! Pours near black with a brown head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma is full of gingerbread with dark chocolate and a dark grain backbone. Flavor is muddled with ginger and graham cracker up front and bourbon and dark grains in the finish.

Dark pour with coppery edges and one finger of dark tan head. Nose is very nice, coconut shows from the barrel with ginger and spice cake. Dense ginger and coconut with spicy notes and sweet bread. Dry spice and medium full body.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks nimbleprop! Dark black pour with tan head, aroma bursted with spice, lots of cardamom, cinnamon, and nutmeg, ginger comes through into the more bread, chocolatey notes with some bourbon, vanilla notes as well. Taste is also spice forward, but there is some vanilla, chocolate, and coffee notes into some sweet lactose, some dark fruit almost into some big ginger, cardamom, cinnamon, and nutmeg, a hint of the bourbon comes through but pretty hidden, finishing spicy, slightly sweet. 6 months or so to tame down the spice would do it wonders.
Bomber shared by Armin - thanks! This is excellent - Christmas in a bottle is spot on. Dark pour. Big cardamom. Holiday spices. Ginger bread. Slick smooth palate. Yum.
Bottle..Pour is black with a tan head..Nose is ginger, bourbon, oak, chocolate, spice...Taste is chocolate, ginger, honey, spice, ginger is a bit much.
750ml, caged and corked bottle. Poured a black color with an averaged sized off white head. Vanilla, gingerbread, spices, wood, and bourbon.

Bottle split at Bruces pad - for the last time, thanks to Bropeyt, 27/03/15.
Black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is spice, ginger, squirt of WD40 (I dont take credit for this but its bang on!), biscuit, toffee apple.
Taste comprises gingerbread, carrot cake, spice, subtle bourbon, dark fruit rinds.
Medium + body, oily feel, semi drying close.
Decent stuff, definately a top end beer for the style, nice balance.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 27th March 2015Swan Song at Bruces. Thanks to Paul. Almost opaque dark brown beer, good cream colour head. Mild nose of ginger cake and malt cream. Little WD40 - post application! Palate is airy and soft with mild fine carbonation. Malt cream. Ginger cake. carrot cake. Trace of something medicinal. Modest fruity bourbon brings light spice. Soft finish. Unusual and very tasty.

Bottle share, thanks to Paul! Bottled 2014 at 10.6%. Pitch black, small foamy tan head. Aroma is crystallised ginger, dettol, shower cleaner, lemonade. Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation. Taste is ginger, spice, dense cake, finishes straw dry. Nice.

Bottle via trade, shared at Bruces. It pours dark brown with medium light tan head. The nose is bitter-sweet, milky, ginger snaps, butterscotch, WD40, vanilla and carrot cake. The taste is smooth, bitter-sweet, roasty, light spice, bitter-sweet, earth, bourbon, sweet, sticky, warming alcohol, butterscotch, vanilla, carrot cake and toasty brown sugar with a smooth finish. Medium-full body and fine carbonation. Great aroma and pretty slick all-round. Good.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Paul. Pours rich, deep brown with a creamy, tan head. Nice aroma with some definite cinnamon, toasty bread, bit of WD-40. Medium sweet flavor with some notes of cocoa, burnt gingerbread, burnt toffee, slight earthy bitterness, dusty cinnamon. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation and creamy texture. Warming finish with some caramel and cinnamon, cocoa, more gingerbread, very slight smoke. Great stuff.

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged. Black pour with a tall, dense, fluffy brown head. Aroma is gingerbread cookies, spices, vanilla, cinnamon, roasted malt and light coffee. Taste can be summed up in a word - WOW! I must say, this might be one of the best beers Ive had in a long time! Gingerbread cookies, cinnamon, vanilla, toasted malt, caramel, bourbon notes, candy and cocoa. Body is medium-full with a dense, bubbly carbonation and is sticky throughout. Ends with more gingerbread, boozy notes, caramel, cinnamon, spices, vanilla, dark bread, cocoa, chocolate and roasted malt. Absolutely delicious!

Bottle from trade with blazay - cheers! Poured into snifter, Black pour, slightly transparent, pale eggshell head. Thick, sweet spiced aroma, huge gingerbread and cinnamon aroma. Medium to light carbonation. Big sweetness along with allspice, cinnamon, ginger, some roast but the sweetness and spices take centre stage. On the finish the barrel kicks in, plenty of vanilla and oak to smooth it out. Its good, but its very sweet, and ultimately not as drinkable as Christmas Morning, where the coffee bitterness takes the edge off the thick, sweet base beer.

Draft - Its just gingerbread, which is a good thing. Jet black with a decent light brown head. Gingerbread again. Thank god I like gingerbread, but it is pretty far removed from beer. Nonetheless I love it.

750ml. Thanks Richard. Black pour. Lots of gingerbread strong enough that it doesnt allow much bourbon through, but the barrel aging does take off much of the gingerbread harshness that youll get from the regular. Pretty good, better than the original.

Pours jet black with a thick mocha head. Aroma big on ginger, cinnamon vanilla and bourbon to follow. Taste is big ginger, cinnamon, bourbon, oak and vanilla. Nice balance of favors, not too bourbon forward, nice.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of vanilla and cinnamon and ginger, some roasted malts, notes of bourbon and oak, light chocolate and hints of milk, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything, but could use more bourbon and oak for sure. Smooth texture. A cool beer but I think the non-aged version might be better if my memory is correct.
Bottle shared by Ken. Same big gingerbread aroma and taste as regular but with more complexity as the bourbon changes the color and overall taste to creamier and darker.

Absolutely beautiful, black with a lacing tan head. The aroma is roast malt with some vanilla and bourbon. The taste is very sweet with the ginger vanilla. This is a dessert beer. I wish I had some vanilla ice cream. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at Churchkey. Gorgeous aroma of vanilla and spice. Taste has chocolate, vanilla, Christmas spice. Delicious.

Draft. Small beige head atop muddy brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, ginger, light Bourbon/vanilla. Taste is moderately sweet, vanilla, caramel, some Bourbon, alcohol warming. Medium-full body, some stickiness, low carbonation.

Pretty well tempered for something I wouldnt usually like on principle. Light gingerbread and well integrated barrel. Definitely not the best Virginia beer Ive had but decent for what it is. Tap thanks to DClawyer.

750 cc. deep blackish brown with frothy, tan head. Nose is heavy gingerbread, roasty malt, Tastes very gingerbready, malty, with some roasty and lactic finishing flavors. This would be a great dessert beer with holiday fare such as stollen or cookies, and is a great beer in and of itself. Perhaps a bit on the sweet side, but unique and enjoyable.

Dark black in color with light tan head... Velvety pour... Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, gingerbread, cinnamon, spices... Flavor is much more complex than regular GBS and less thin, lots of bourbon notes, vanilla, cinnamon, gingerbread spices with light heat and spices on finish... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle it is a dark brown with a slight head. The aroma is vanilla and the taste is nutmeg, vanilla, and black livorice

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown mahogany color with a creamy tan head. Aroma is tons of chocolate, gingerbread, holiday spice, touch of vanilla and bourbon. Flavor packs a huge holiday feel, with lots of gingerbread, spice, and only a faint bourbon vanilla character. Medium body with a long lingering gingerbread and vanilla sweetness. Fantastic beer. The bourbon aged definitely does not overpower the already delicious base beer.
Bottle. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of ginger, bourbon, oak, cookie, vanilla, coffee, cinnamon, gingerbread and chocolate. Medium body.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Fruity, spicy gingerbread, clove and vanilla.

2012 vintage bottle reviewed from notes. 
Aroma has moderate chocolate and roast with tons of gingerbread character and hints of bourbon. Light alcohol spice hidden well by the gingerbread spice. 
Pours dark brown with ruby hues and a dark tan head with good retention. 
Flavor is somewhat chocolatey with some roast and moderate sweetness. Gingerbread spice dominates the flavor with light bourbon and oak notes. Light alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Medium astringency and medium alcohol. 
Overall, an alright beer but the adjuncts dominate and hide the base beer. I do not like when the adjuncts dominate so much.

Bottle. Deep brown with a small head. Nose of gingersnap cookies, Cocoa, chocolate. Boozy heat. Taste is similar. Sweet hot vanilla and loads of ginger. Proper cinnamon spiciness and coffee, dark chocolate. Medium body, soft carb. Good
Weak aroma (kind of flat pour), opaque dark brown color. Malty with enough ginger to live up to the name. Some hop bite, or was that the ginger. Finishes like a good cookie.

750mL bottle, pours black with a very small beige head. Nose brings out lots of the gingerbread, along with vanilla, cinnamon and very light oak. Flavour is spicy in an elegant way, with notes of cinnamon and vanilla, followed by some oak. Very complex, with the spices used to perfection. Excellent beer.
Bourbon-gingerbread cookie aroma. Spicy, well-balanced barrel, delicious. I dig.

(750ml bottle)clear medium brown, light carbonation and tan head. Nose of gingerbread, bourbon, graham cracker, Christmas, and cream. Taste is really gingery, touch of bourbon, heavy on spices, juniper, super estery. Liked it at first but the longer I drink it the less I like it.

Bottle sampled at Muckfest V on 7/11/14. Dark brown pour with a thin tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, bourbon and some spice. Flavor of cinnamoned bourbon with some dark chocolate before a roasty finish.

750 ml bottle from RABinCO back when he was RABinVA - thanks again, Ryan! Pours a deep amber color with a small tan head. Lighter in color than the regular Gingerbread Stout. Notes of gingerbread, caramel, brown sugar, wood, earth, pepper, honey, vanilla, earth, and bourbon. But the bourbon is pretty light overall, just adds some sweetness to the regular one. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet, spicy, malty mouthfeel. Good treatment, but I just dont think the base beer is as strong as it should be.

Bottle @ RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy gingerbread aroma with hints of bourbon. Roasted malty woody spicy gingerbread flavor with hints of bourbon. Has a roasted malty woody gingerbread finish.

Bottle @ RBSG 2014 Grand Tasting. Just about black with a khaki head. Definitely some gingerbread aromas. Molasses, vanilla, and a hint of chocolate. Mild whiskey and clove. Strong ground ginger aroma. Flavor has a nice spicy ginger character to it. A bit of roast, molasses sweetness, and vanilla. Some sweet bourbon and toffee maltiness. Nice cocoa powder, too.
Shared at RBSG 2014. Thanks Peter! Nose us an amazing gingerbread cookie and light booze. Light black with brown tones. Taste is a bourbon ball crossed with gingerbread cookies. A touch warming.

Draft at Rustico Ballston. This one poured a near pitch black color with little more than a wispy, small tan head to it. Aroma was some light spices, roasted and sweet malt characters, and what appears to be gingerbread, lots of boozy notes - oak barrel. Flavor is still strong with the holiday spices - lots of dried fruits, bourbon character is perhaps a bit subdued compared to fresh, but its still there. Lots of booze. Enjoyable, pretty smooth, just a touch rough. Hope to try this one again when its released at the end of the year.

Draft at Rustico Ballston. Pours a dark brownish black with tan head. Aromas of bourbon, ginger, mint, cinnamon. Tasting notes of bourbon, ginger, cinnamon, dark chocolate. Medium-full body with a dry finish. Bourbon notes seems to have faded compared to when I had this fresh at the Hardywood release.
On draft at Rustico in Arlington. Pours black with a tan head. Flavors of bourbon and some cola. Gingerbread is not very evident. Boozy finish. Nice.

On tap at Rustico Ballston. Pours a still opaque black with ring of bubbles at glass. Maroon hue when backlit. Aroma is ginger, bourbon and cinnamon. Flavor is roasty sweet with spicy complexity. A clean finish, awesome.
Draft at EBF, overflowing bourbon sweetness, slightly burn molasses flavor, not my thing at all, really boozy.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Bottle... darkguardians & biggsbowlers West Palm Beach Birthday Bash!... Murky dark brown pour with a small, creamy, taupe head. Good retention. Not much of an aroma here. The barrel has stripped the beer of any gingerbread component and added virtually no bourbon character. Full-bodied and creamy with prickly carbonation. The flavor offers subdued sweetness, chocolate and deep-roast malts, but no gingerbread facet remains. Finishes carbonic, sweet and then bitter. Good stuff, but I enjoyed the untreated base beer far more. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave, Harris and Jordan on 4/11/2014.
Appearance: Pours a dark brown black.
Aroma: Aroma of cinnamon, light bourbon.
Taste: Gingerbread, cinnamon, bourbon, light chocolate.
Palate:Medium body, lightly sticky.
Summary: Thanks to Jordan for sharing this rare treat! I had the Hardywood Gingerbread Stout at their launch party, and this was great to try too.

On tap good milk stout with gingerbread cookie overtones 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a medium brown. Heavy gingerbread aroma with chocolate. Thin body very sweet

This one poured a darker brown with a biege head. Aroma was of chocolate, cinnamon, ginger and coffee and bourbon. Falvor was similar, very smooth boutbon, but did not get much complex gingerbread underneath
Dark black with a 3 mm head. Smells great. Where the hell is Mr. Gingerbread? Love this beer. Regular is cool. BB is sooooo much better. Too bad they lost 50 barrels of this in 2013 due to a clamp!

2012 bottle. Dark burnt orange pour. Nose at first is some bourbon, gingerbread, vanilla, booze. Nose becomes more bourbon forward as it warms. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, ash, some ginger but less than I expected. Silky oily medium mouthfeel.

Location: 750 ml bottle from Pinsky, Thanks bud!, 1/12/13, 2013 Release


Aroma: The nose is bourbon over ginger bread cookies, roasted malt, molasses, and brown sugar

Appearance: A dark brown color, fairly thick pour, and a small ring of beige head with spotty lace

Flavor: The flavor is actually extremely well-balanced, the bourbon adds an excellent boozy component to the base beer that leans toward the sweet side, and the spice works nicely here too

Palate: The body is medium, leaning full, it smooth and almost silky, with a dry, bourbony finish

Overall Impression: 
This is excellent.  This base beer was really meant for the barrel treatment.  I love how the bourbon plays with the sweetness without overwhelming the underlying beer.  Truly a world-class offering.  Thanks again Pinsky!

Draft at the American Taproom during a five course meal with Hardywood beers This was the last beer served with the desert. The stout pours a deep ruby brown to black. Nice small tan foam head. The gingerbread is not hard to notice on the nose. Some toffee and dark sugar as well. The stout taste like a gingerbread with bourbon chaser. The alcohol provides a nice warm feeling. This went well with the desert. The medium body stout had soft carbonation.

Bottle, huge thanks to Walt for this one! Pours deep chestnut ruby, medium tan head, some lacing. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, coconut. Flavor is the same, plus ginger, medium sweet, little bitterness. Medium body.

12/7/2013. On tap at the brewery on release. Pours black with a beige head. Sweet spicy aromas with chocolate, dark roasted malt and fruit. The oak ageing adds a bit more dimension to the beer than the regular lease. Great brew for the Holidays.
UPDATED: DEC 19, 2013 On tap at the release, pours black with low head. Aroma is sweet bourbon and ginger notes, taste is awesome sweet chocolate gingerbread, could use some more body, awesome beer

A: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Minimal Light, Off White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Cinnamon, Molasses, Brown Sugar, Sweet Bread

T: Molasses, Brown Sugar, Mild Bourbon, Mild Cinnamon

M: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Boozy

Overall, the flavors really do combine very well to recreate that gingerbread taste and the bourbon sweetens up the flavors just a touch more.
Sample from bottle  pours a dark charcoal . Foam level is acceptable .. . Bold spice, burnt rum cake and ash ... Could never do a whole bottle by myself .. . . Time for bed young man!

Pours deep red with little carbonation. 

Smell is light oak, vanilla and cherry.

Taste is sweet ashy, vanilla and ginger. Bigger taste than the non BA version.

Fuller bodied than the regular version.

Wasnt blown away by either this or the regular version, but I didnt have them fresh.
Ba bottle share. Less ginger, some more bourbon. One of the few times i like the none ba version more, still good.

750 ml bottle shared by mikem409 on 1/1/2013. Pours dark brown in color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have a nice mix of the good stout characteristics: roast, chocolate and caramel with the addition of gingerbread cookies, spices and bourbon/vanilla from the barrel. Everything seemed to work pretty well together; tasty.
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Bottle. Black pour with some tan lacing. Aroma of muted ginger, roasted malt and light bourbon. Flavor is of gingerbread, spice and light appertif like alcohols. Christmassy.

Bottle shared at Chris birthday bash.  Brown pour with a kaki head.  Boozy aromas.  Booze not bourbon, roasted malts and cinnamon notes with noticeable bitterness from the hops.  God body and mouthfeel.
Super dark brown pour, brown head.  Flavors of christmas cookies, bourbon, spice, molasses.  Sweet and freaking delicious.
The regular edition was kind of meh but this one man, the ginger, malt, cocoa, and bourbon all come together.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2014 Original rating: Kind of exactly what you expect reading the discription. Vanilla, bourbon and too, too, too much cinnamon. Thin and kind of bitter. Too light in flavor for the strngth. 7 3 6 3 11



RBSG 2014 Rating: This is very black w/ a small head w/ very tight brown bubbles. It has a touch of cinnamon and a minty herbal character to it. Its quite sweet and full bodied, a little sticky w/ a complex, spicy coffee-like taste. 6 4 8 4 14



Rating is an average of these two.

midnight black - small head
candy corns, sugar and simple syrup. some ginger spice and vanilla
Doing this side by side with GBS, this is a much better variant. The vanilla and sweetness from the BA treatment really makes the spices and ginger jump out. Its not A+ but its far better than the non BA one.
Bottle at a bottle share. Pours a strangely light color. Nose has some strong gingerbread notes to it. Taste is much like a cookie, and seems very sweet. Smooth, but a tad odd.

Poured a dark brown almost black color from the bottle.  Aromas of ginger, booze, cinnamon, light toffee and some caramel.  Flavors are the same ginger, cookies, cinnamon and booze.  Great beer ocerall thanks for the share.

Sampled at the CCB/RateBeer/Pre-Hunah Tasting (Tampa, FL). Pours a nice cocoa and toffee darker pour, touches of brownish glow on the edges, mellow firm haze. Frothy tannish head atop dies to a ring, laces small. Aromas are cocoa, toffee, gentle roast and toast. Mellow cinnamon, ginger, and spice. Touches of oak, vanilla, more gentle barrel experience, but it still covers up the spice a bit. Initial is sweeter, darker, cocoa and vanilla, gentle spirit. Ginger, cinnamon, some vanilla life. Middle is sweeter, cinnamon and ginger presence, some creamy vanilla and nice sweetness at times. Spirit, toast, toffee. A touch sweet. Cinnamon and spice assert into finish, nice flavors, gingerbread, some spirit, vanilla, gentle spiciness lingers with mellow heat, toffee, and creamy sweetness. Lesser bodied as we move on. Nice.
Bottle. Pours brown with a small tanned head. Aroma is gingerbread, just like baking them at Christmas, some barrel; very nice. Flavor is ginger, astringent malty fruity bitter but too spicy.

Thanks to the kind soul who shared this at the Thursday pre-Hunahpu tasting.  Pours a hazy brown with an off-white head.  Nose is bourbon, spices, chocolate, caramel, toffee, and some ginger with cinnamon.  Flavor is a nice blend of spices, cinnamon, bourbon, oak, vanilla, and some light booze.  Medium in body, a bit lighter than Id think, but a solid and complex beer overall.
Thanks to maniac for this bottle! Walnut colored pour. Nose and flavor bring sweet bourbon vanilla, gingerbread, molasses, and cinnamon toast crunch. Honestly pretty tasty, but not complex.

Thanks to Lunch for sharing this bottle.  Served in a Hardywood goblet.  Pours dark.  The nose has loads of bourbon atop hefty spice and a bit of vanilla, chocolate, and roast.  Flavor is similarly dominated by bourbon and spice.  The bourbon does a good job knocking out some of the spice, but then itself is too strong.  Spice and bourbon, not much else.

Aroma of sharp ginger, cookies and almost a peppermint chocolate.  Pours black with a nice white lacing.  Taste is intense with ginger and mint up front and a nice chocolate cookie back.  Nice toffee vanilla notes are hidden but there.  Neat beer but I wouldnt repeat.

Richmond 19th, thanks graham!  Aroma is very bready, hint of chocolate, touch medicinal.  Flavor is a match, with a good hit of vanilla and hint of oak.  Boozy on the finish.  No real ginger presence, but good.  Touch of gingerbread at the very, very end.  Really liked this one, probably more than this rating indicates.
RG 19. Bottle. Fairly dark with foamy tan head. Smells a little like cherry cough syrup plus chocolate. Tastes like chocolate cherries.
Very oaky bourbon nose. Clear cola, thin head. Coconut, vanilla, and bourbon flavor. Despite the barrel treatment, gingerbread is still prominent.

750ml bottle pours an opaque black with some cloudy beige head.  Crazy nose, coconut, gingerbread, vanilla, cola, toast, a little cake icing.  Flavor is sweet, loads of wet coconut meat, light ginger, a little sun tan lotion, cola, some grape jelly.  Full, sweet, slightly spicy finish.
From the bottle poured a dark brown brew with a tan head. Aroma and flavors of malt, coconut, spices. Medium bodied.

sepia with thin tan oily head. Nose is of course gingerbread, light spirit heat, wood. Flavor is sweet, gingerbread and chocolate, especially through finish. Thick body but thin finish. Burnt sugar finish.

750mL thanks to maniac! Pours a clear, deep ruby brown. Weak tan foam. Nose is gingerbread, brown sugar, toffee, red apple, cookie. Taste is apple pie, cookie, nutmeg, warming alcohol heat. Palate is tangy, spicy, bitter. Feels thinner than the normal GBS or whatever they are calling it know.

Bottle: The aroma consists of chocolate, graham cracker, ginger, vanilla, and bourbon. It pours a dark brown with some oange highlights and a small beige head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges of the glass. The flavor starts with a quick dose of chocolate and caramel. The finish has moderate ginger, cinnamon, bourbon, and light vanilla. Its medium bodied with mild carbonation.

750ml 2012 bottle, shared by mikem409. Dark brown color. Good thin light brown head. Good lace. Good bourbon / gingerbread nose. Good bigger body. Light smooth carbonation. More dry finish. Nice light sweet / bitter / spicy taste. Light booze. That gingerbread cookie taste again, but with bourbon now, very nice. Great, flavorful, interesting aftertaste. Delicious, awesome stuff.

750 ml bottle to snifter (BIG thanks mikem409). Looks good; a mostly opaque caramel with off-white lacing. Smells good too; bourbon and gingerbread. Good on the palate too. Damn fine, and even better than the base.
bottle. pours dark brown with medium tan head. aroma of gram cracker and ginger. taste is medium lots of spice and slight barrel

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 Sampled on draft at the Hardywood beer dinner at Popkins Tavern, as well as on draft at the brewery.  While this is quite tasty, as with so many bourbon aged beers, I prefer the basic version.  however, I have been told that the bottled version of the bourbon GBS is the best, but i have yet to try it.  Pours a very dark black  with decent khaki head. Not quite as sweet as the base beer. Earthy, smokey, and not as gingery. Smoother than the original.  Very VERY good.   EDIT:  Finally had it in the bottle.  Its even better than on draft.  A truly amazing brew. EDIT: 2014 bottle release had noticeably less "bourbon" character, and much more notes of vanilla and coconut. Which were absolutely delicious, and its still my favorite varietal, but its worth noting that it does not taste quite the same as those previous vintages.

Poured from a 750 on 12.16.12. This may have been one of my favorite barrel treatments of a beer I already enjoyed ever. The combination of fresh gingerbread stout and the vanilla from the barrel was exceptional. I already like GBS and did not think I would enjoy this as much but what a pleasant surprise. It is a shameit is so hard to get around town or I would be drinking alot more of this one.
Gingerbread and chocolate aromas. Gingerbread, chocolate, vanilla and a little bourbon flavors. Overall fantastic! Thanks Rob!

I couldn't make it to the release today, so Paul graciously hooked me up. Thanks man! Served in a Hardywood glass, because it was there. 

The beer is opaque with a thick beige head. The head lasts for a few moments before fading to nil. The aroma offers cinnamon, vanilla, nutmeg, oak barrel. The flavor is a step up from the aroma. Lots of holiday spices with only a touch of bourbon. Silky smooth on the palate. Beautifully balanced. Like eating a gingerbread cookie. Sweet but never cloying. A great beer for the holidays.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft sample at VA Beer & Cheer Festival, 12/8/12. Pours a dark brown color with a medium sized frothy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, coconut, ginger and roasted malts. The taste is bourbon, wood, chocolate, ginger, vanilla and a bitter hop finish. Medium-full bodied. Lingering bitterness. Very nice.
Tasted at VA Cheer & Beer. Very similar overall to regular gingerbread stout, but with some added vanilla and a nice bourbon bite. It blends very well. Incredibly balanced.
